headline: Baked Omelet
description: Learn how to cook an omelet in the oven with ham, Cheddar, and mozzarella. This simple egg dish is ideal for brunch or breakfast, on holidays or any day!

video.description: Ham and cheese baked omelet is an excellent meal for breakfast or brunch.
video.name: Baked Omelet

name: Baked Omelet

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Whisk eggs and milk together in a bowl. Stir Cheddar, mozzarella, onion, and seasoning salt. Pour into the prepared baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until set, 40 to 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Delicious Quick and easy Reheats fabulously for a an on the go breakfast the next day.
Used steak eggs cheese and beans I added sour cream an milk took about a HOUR to cook but was delicious when it got done
Easy to prepare and bake. I reduced milk and added sour cream. No leftovers

I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious. Because I cut the amount back to one serving (there's just me) it cooked in half the time, just under 20 minutes in my toaster oven on regular bake. It probably would have been even faster on convection bake but I wanted to keep to the recipe as much as possible.. The only change I'll make next time would be to use green onions instead of dried minced. It was nice and fluffy just a bit brown on top and still not dry at all, just right.
It was good, needs more flavor.
Added mushrooms. Family said this omelet was puffy and the most delicious they had ever had!

I use plain yogurt instead of milk. It gives it a nice texture. Also, I make this in my toaster oven. I bake it for 30 minutes and then put it on broil for another 5. It browns the top nicely and doesn't overcook it.

This was so easy and so great! I made it in a glass casserole dish which turned out very pretty. The only change I made was to add sausage to it. So we had both sausage and ham and the flavor was outstanding! After reading some of the other reviews someone suggested melting cheese on top right before it was finished which I also did. This is absolutely fantastic and I will be making it on a regular basis.

Excellent recipe. I added goat cheese instead of mozzarella, added peeled and chopped tomato. Taste is fantastic, didn't make enough because people were coming back for more. Next time I will try adding some mushrooms. The goat cheese really made it a hit.
Updated it for a 9x11 pan and i cluded bacon, peppers, and onions. It was delicious - light and fluffy. AWESOME
moist, fluffy, and tasty. Easy to make and you can add whatever you want.
I hate to say I thought this was just ok. I have never tried a dish like this or breakfast casserole so maybe my expectations were too high. Maybe adding veggies and other seasonings would help.
I didn't have Ham and added a little chopped Onion and Green Pepper. Even so, it was a big hit with the family. Very recommended.
It was a little bland to me, even with all the spices. If I make again, I’ll had a sharp cheddar to the mix.
Delicious! Also made a vegetarian with broccoli, red peppers, carrots, a cauliflower. Need to cook a little longer than stated.
I added finely chopped sweet onion and red peppers the family loved it we will make this again

It was pretty good, I'm always looking for different breakfast ideas. I added many items, chopped ham, green pepper, sliced grape tomatoes, garlic and onion powders, and black pepper. Mine was baked in a 7 inch round ramekin and took longer to bake than directed. It was certainly an easy dish to make and fuss free. I would make it again.
Great recipe, very tasty! I myself added a bit of spinach and some chopped up tomatoes, really adds to the dish. Great for brunch alongside a nice biscuit, would definitely make again. :)
I used 5 eggs and 5/8 1 cup of milk and used turkey and cooked grated potatoes and it was awesome.
This cooked up light and fluffy. You can use any meat, cheese or veg combo you want. I added some diced sweet onions with ham and used shredded taco cheese. This took a solid hour to cook in my oven.
Very easy to make. Light fluffy was finished baking before time was up. Delicious I would definitely recommend this recipe .

Made this at work for a co-worker's birthday, we forgot the salt and it still turned out wonderfully!!
Can't wait to make it again!
I added to the recipe and used an cast iron skillet for baking it in. I added spinach and fresh cherry tomatoes.

Wonderful. I doubled it and put in a 9x13. I put 8 oz. crumbled cooked sausage instead of ham. I used about a cup of chopped onion instead of dry, didn't measure that's a guess. I think I'll make it next for a church breakfast. Quick and easy!
Yes will make it again .
It was easy to make and tasted delicious and light.

4.17.19 It was breakfast for dinner last night, and Baked Omelet was the star of the meal. I thought a sprinkle of paprika might give the omelet a little more eye appeal, but instead, all it did was make the top way too brown…my bad! It really baked up similar to a souffle, climbing up the sides of the dish, so be sure your dish has enough room to allow this to happen. I followed the recipe except for adding a little chopped red bell pepper which was in the fridge, and instead of 8 eggs, used one container of Egg Beaters® plus one egg to get the cholesterol down. It was light, fluffy, and cooked up beautifully. No fussing or watching the omelet cooking in a skillet on a stove top, this just goes into the oven, and then you can focus on the other things you’re planning to serve with it. Quick and easy and most important delicious!
This was better than any omelette I've had. It was moist, fluffy, an just delightful. I only omitted the onions because we hate them, but otherwise, it was great.

The recipe was amazing! i didn’t have cheddar cheese or shredded cheese so i improvised with mozzarella string cheese and diced it really small and it worked great! i also added a dash of parsley flakes to the recipe and baked it for 44 minutes and it was perfectly baked! I’ll definitely make this recipe again! 10/10 loved it!
Sorry we did not care for this at all. My husband said they taste like microwaved eggs. Daughter said they were spongy. Loved the concept but won’t make it again.

It tastes really nice, i made some slight variations of my own:
*i used 5 eggs (enough for meal for 2 plus two small kids)
*less salt
*proportion the milk, too much will flood it
*added instead of mozzerella just regular cheddar cheese and i added 2 spoonfuls of philedelphia cream cheese
*i pre fried the veg to add like celantro or spring onions, green pepper bell small, and a tiny piece of onion finely chopped, oregano. then add to the mix. plus bacon finely diced pre fried to add to mix.
*oven time setting needed be slight higher maybe 400 to 450c (gas mark 4.5 to 5) there was still fluid at the bottom i uses a fork to check and opened up airpockets so it cooked fully...it took 1 hour nearly!!

it went down well with a slice of bread toasted for brunch!

Delicious easy and defiantly a keeper. Good for my keto diet as well. Just a tiny bit of liquid at the bottom after cooked, not bad though. Eggs were fluffy and just enough cheese and ham. I did what another reviewer suggested and made sure not to cook the omelet too close to the bottom over rack to avoid over cooking the bottom of the dish. Thanks for the recipe
Kids loved it, great for Christmas morning!
I made this! Great recipe! I will add some different or a variety of items next time. Versatile meal! Thanks!

I didn’t have ham, so I increased the cheese slightly, and used a combo of English cheddar and firm goat cheese that I had leftover from a cheese plate. Also used 1/2 t onion powder because I didn’t have dried minced onion. It puffed beautifully and was simple to make; would def make again.
It is excellent!
I halved the recipe. It was good. Thanks for sharing your recipe.
This was delicious! I added a little more ham because I had it. I also added dill because I like dill on my eggs. Will definitely make again.

This is a great basic recipe. I made it as directed, except I sautéed the ham and added fresh green onions to it at the end, just to soften them, instead of the dried minced onion. I may reduce the milk to 3/4 cup next time. Wonderful recipe to add your choice of veggies!
Delicious and easy to make. Perfect Sunday morning breakfast for the family!
Very easy to make, I made it with bacon, it was scrumptious!!
Followed the instructions to a "T" . Served as pancake sandwich it was a big hit.
Very tasty. I even had all the ingredients without going shopping.
I've used this recipe several times. Each time I add an extra ingredient (a veggie) and every time it's flavorful. I love how moist it turns out
Light and fluffy omelet. I made it as is and topped with chives and cheddar cheese. Very easy to make

Made this for Breakfast for Dinner night the night after I got home from a long road trip, because it was so easy. Used bacon in place of ham, as I didn’t have any defrosted, but other than that made exactly as written. Loved the combo of the cheeses, but you could certainly change those up, the recipe is so versatile. Next time I might throw in some ground mustard, just for grins. Served with pumpkin cornbread muffins and scalloped apples, made a very satisfying dinner.

Amazing! I took someone’s advice and used muffin tins to pour them into rather than a casserole dish. Only took 30 mins to cook in my convection oven and we each ate about 3-5 pies. I learned for next time however, that I’ll put the egg & milk mixture into each muffin spot first, and then sprinkle cheese and ham into each spot one at a time. What happened when I did this the first time, is that I mixed all ingredients together and used a large spoon to scoop them into the muffin spots. The result was that a some had mostly egg and others were loaded with cheese. The sizes of them were all different as they were weighed down. Trust me, they taste much better being weighed down!’ So this new way will ensure that it’s even.
Made it for a crowd of 8. We all loved it. I will definitely make it again. It was an easy breakfast to make for a crowd.
Wonderful, flavorful, and fluffy. Add whatever veggies and still turns out great.
This is an excellent recipe, very customizable. We love to make individual ramikens. The eggs stay nice and hot for a long time.
4.5 stars
I made this in a muffin pan for individual servings and ate it all week for breakfast. Super easy!
I modified this to fit my diet restrictions (dairy and gf) but the bake time and ratios I stuck to and it was delicious!!
A great coming home from work recipie or to just use whatever in is the fridge at the time. Very effective, fluffy and extremely tasty.

Very yummy! This is what I did. I cooked three strips of bacon and set aside to crumble. I then cooked half of a diced onion and a 1/4 piece of diced yellow bell pepper in the bacon grease. After beating the eight eggs with the cup of milk, I added a small shake of salt and some freshly ground pepper. Next, I added in the cheese and the onion/pepper mixture.Mixed in the crumbled bacon and baked in the glass pan for 40 minutes adding a bit more cheddar on top for the last couple of minutes to melt. This was a very good breakfast. Served with some southern grits.

This is very good, puffs up nicely, and a great way to make an omelette. I halve the recipe if it's just the two of us. Have used crumbled bacon instead of ham, and added mushrooms. A few shakes of hot sauce perks it up a bit. I like it topped with a little salsa and sour cream or yogurt. It's a regular with variations at our house.
I used just mozzarella but would used part cheddar next time

This recipe is top notch for its simplicity and versatility! I made two different combinations for Christmas morning, and both baked up perfectly. I used 5 eggs each, in 8x8 Pyrex and this took only about 25-30 mins. Could easily have fit the 8 egg volume in this size dish as well.
I prepped my "mix ins" the evening before. In the morning, it was quick and simple to prepare and get everything in the oven.
This was a really nice simple accompaniment to a small buffet which was otherwise heavy on sweets, breads, and fruits.

We thought this was delicious. I used almond milk, homemade sausage and cheddar and gouda, which is what I had in my refrigerator. I will be making this for the holidays, and experimenting with adding different vegies.
This tasted great! only thing differently I did was add Tator Tots in it. Had to bake it longer but it turned out great and was very yummy. will make again!
This is so very easy and versatile. The Hubs and I prefer ham with asparagus and Swiss cheese, but I have made it with many other combinations.
it was very easy-all in 1, I added canned salmon.
Easy company recipe. Added fresh spinach. Will add mushrooms next time. Served with Trader Joe's Almond Croissants. Very yummy.

I have a delicious eggs frittata recipe I make when wanting to do an egg casserole but it's more time consuming and has a ton of ingredients. I loved this because it's super easy and I followed the directions to a T and it turned out great! Awesome "breakfast for dinner" recipe or anytime you need an easy and delicious egg recipe!

This is an awesome and easy quick breakfast! You can throw in just about anything you want. Leftovers are perfect for making breakfast burritos, just cut it lengthwise and throw it in a tortilla! Easy to re-heat as well
It was good but mine certainly didn't rise like the photo. But I would make it again.
I have made this recipe several times-always adding something fresh-red pepper, onion, and spinach-basically whatever is in the fridge! Great meal for weeknight with a salad or fruit!!

This was delicious! My family loved it! I was expecting it to be good, but it was much more - spectacular! I made no changes except I only had cheddar, so that's what it got. I can't wait to make it again for a special occasion brunch dish.
I made this recipe just as written. My family loved it and so did I. I definitely will make it again. It took exactly 45 minutes!!!

I recently made this recipe again for a special occasion Every time I make it I am reminded of back when airline travel was a pleasant experience. One airline served it for breakfast on a cross country flight I frequented. 
I separate the egg whites and whip them up just a bit. Not enough to make a souffle. Add to mixed yolks any cheeses, meats, veggies, herbs that strike your fancy. Gently stir in whites. Butter baking dish well and bake on middle rack. So creamy/fluffy on inside and just barely browned on outside. Baked and served in individual dishes with mixed fruit and oven browned cubed potatoes makes a special breakfast.

Great recipe. I used 6 eggs, 3/4 cup milk, both cheeses, some chives, and some parsley. The final result was tasty, looked great, and was very easy to prepare. I didn't think any additional salt was necessary for an excellent taste.
Very easy to make and tastes great!!

Made this for my parents anniversary and served Breakfast in Bed style (with a side of homemade biscuits, home fries, and a small dish of peach slices) They LOVED it, and they're generally not breakfast people. I did use parmesan instead of mozzarella and tomatoes instead of ham. It was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G thank you so much for sharing this recipe!
Very tasty, very easy and will definitely make it again. Didn't have any dried onion flakes, so used garlic powder instead & tossed in a handful of frozen peas for good measure. Loved it.

Compared to the fried variety, this is far superior. Light and fluffy which you don't see on a fried omelette. I did alter the ingredients a bit, as I used what I had. Fresh onions instead of dried, and back bacon instead of ham. I also used lactaid free milk, but no issues in any other areas. I served this up as a late supper, with a bottle of Riesling. I will be making it again for sure. I like being able to get it ready, put it in the oven, and only checking it periodically. Great method.

I make an individual serving of this recipe in a big mug. I use frozen diced or hash browned potatoes as a base with two chopped veggie breakfast sausage links (Morningstar) on top. I mix two eggs with a splash of milk, a couple of green onions and whatever cheese I'm using and pour that over the sausage and potatoes and bake for 45 minutes, Delish!
Not bad, although I had to cook this close to an hour.
This was soooo easy. I used mushrooms and liquid egg whites too. It's a great snack for work! Delicious too....

Great recipe. I made it as indicated, and I've also subbed bacon for the ham and swapped out the cheeses, just based on what I have on hand. I cut it into 4 squares and put each one in a ziplock bag in the fridge. To reheat in the morning, I unzip the bag, but leave the omelet inside. Heat for 1—1.5 minutes at about 70% power. We like it served with salsa.

Yes, l made, but was going use sour cream as another reviewer suggested. By mistake I used cream cheese instead....Wow. It was wonderful. The recipe was sent home with our guests with the change to cream cheese. It's better to be lucky than good.

Excellent basic recipe which can be easily changed to your own preference. In my case I used sausage vs ham, cut up sliced Italian blend cheese vs the cheddar, diced small 1 T sweet onion vs the dehydrated onion, added 1 cup of cut up fresh baby spinach, used 2% milk vs reg milk, added some fresh ground pepper. It came out excellent per myself and my husband. On the second day I added 1 T water to baking dish, covered tightly with aluminum foil and reheated second half of the omelette in the oven at 350 for 30 minutes, then removed from oven and let rest for 5 minutes. This was a great first day and also second day leftover breakfast. Thanks for the great recipe!
Was very light and fluffy. I added some fresh spinach because I like that combo. Will add a few dashes of hot sauce next time.
Loved the baked omelet recipe. Simple and short!
My husband and I loved it.. I did add cooked sausage instead of cooked ham and it was amazing. I imagine cooked bacon could be great too!

Wow, this is fantastic! I had leftover hot dogs and red pepper that I put in along with some minced onions and I will definitely make this with anything else I have on hand, good recipe. Thank You for submitting.

Between three and four actually, but I'm giving it the benefit since we changed it up-though we added lots of tastey ingredients.. My mom made this for me when I wasn't feeling well. It was pretty good. She made it vegetarian by replacing the ham with chopped mushrooms. She also added red and green bell peppers and chopped marinated artichoke hearts (my request-along with the mushrooms, because I'm not a lover of ham in my souffles). She used the cheddar cheese, but substituted a Parmesan mixture for the mozzarella. It was alright, but we all felt it could use more salt, perhaps because the ham was left out, even though Parmesan cheese is salty. With all my favorite ingredients it was still bland and salt would definitely help. I also really didn't care for the fluffy texture of the eggs. I think I would have preferred more cheese, so with the leftovers I might warm it up with melted cheese on top, extra salt, some fresh chives, sour cream, and chopped tomatoes to boost the flavor- it needs it. The good thing about a recipe like this is that it is super easy to customize. For us it made more than 5 servings when served with a salad, but perhaps that was because of the load of ingredients we added.

My review will not be very helpful! I do think the basic recipe is a perfect starting place. I added mushrooms, spinach that I had sautéed prior to adding. Other than that I added Ortega chills and a little Greek yogurt. We loved it, the taste and consistency.
Very good omelet. Baked instead of fried. Ingredients can be made to your preference. Thumbs up!
Easy to cook and very fluffy:-).

This is such an amazing recipe and I will be making it again. My little brother loved it. I added some tomatoes and spinach, I also used garlic powder and pepper. I ate it with some wheat waffles and had an amazing breakfast.

Really simple and delicious. I sauteed onions, garlic, zucchini, and mushrooms and replaced the ham with bacon. Also used sharp cheddar and pepper jack instead of the mozz. The only thing is I used olive oil for the veggies and it was a little oily so I will use less next time. Really fluffy and gone quick with some hungry mouths. Will make again.

This is a wonderful solution for those of us who aren't very good at making omelettes. I believe you could put anything you want in it and it would be delicious. I added sauteed swiss chard and mushrooms with regular onion. Will be making this again and again. Thanks for sharing.
Excellent, followed the recipe but with out seasoning salt, used Tony Chacheres Creole Seasoning and it was great. Great simple fast omelet that will wow your guests :)
We love this recipe so much that we have made it 3 times in 2 weeks. We made it exactly as directed. Yum!!!
Very good the only thing I did differently was use sweet turkey and hot sausage, peppers, and onions
So easy.....and it turned out perfect! I would add a little more cheese on top toward the last few minutes. Other than that I wouldn't change a thing! Forgot to take a picture before we ate it all!

Loved it!
I used white and regular cheddar, pepper jack and mozzarella cheese... cut up mushrooms and mixed it with some Hot salsa instead of salt or pepper and cutting onions.
It came out nice and fluffy with a little kick in each bite. And I saved my eyes from cutting up onions!

Great as is.

I also made it with a few tablespoons of scallions which added a nice addition.

This was a pretty good recipe. I followed it almost exactly except to substitute bacon for the ham. Several people commented on how much they liked it. I will make this again and maybe add some feta cheese and/or broccoli. All in all a good fall back recipe for a crowd.
